content:
@Alya Abbott This is the reactivate user confirmation modal, are you have any suggestions for the message?
reactivate_user_confirmation.png

This is how it will look/work overall.
reactivate_user_popover.gif

@yogesh sirsat I think that looks pretty reasonable. We're likely to want to add a link to https://vandystats.zulip.com/help/deactivate-or-reactivate-a-user#reactivate-a-user, which we'll want to extend with a couple sentences about how they will be subscribed to the same streams they were before their account was deactivated, how they can login, etc., some of which we may want to copy into the modal.

reactivate_user_popover.png

I put the help link in the ? icon,
I didn't find any information about how they can log in, can they log in the same as before?
While working on it, I noticed that in settings there is a confirmation modal for deactivate users, but not for reactivate, is PR worth it?

And if we are accepting the ? icon for reactivate confirmation modal, then deactivate confirmation modal should also have it, isn't it?
Currently, there is a ? icon already for the mute user confirmation modal.

While working on it, I noticed that in settings there is a confirmation modal for deactivate users, but not for reactivate, is PR worth it?

Yeah, I think it would be an improvement to have a confirmation modal when reactivating the user from the settings as well.
We can use the text in the screenshot above for now; I'll think about how to fine-tune it when reviewing the PR.

And if we are accepting the ? icon for reactivate confirmation modal, then deactivate confirmation modal should also have it, isn't it?

Adding a help center link to the deactivation modal as well makes sense to me.
Thanks for looking closely at the surrounding parts of the product and suggesting improvements!
@Sahil Batra I have left some comments of doubt related to reactivate user, on PR #21436.

Alya Abbott said:

Yeah, I think it would be an improvement to have a confirmation modal when reactivating the user from the settings as well.

Adding a help center link to the deactivation modal as well makes sense to me.

Should I open issues first or post direct PRs?

yogesh sirsat said:

Alya Abbott said:

Yeah, I think it would be an improvement to have a confirmation modal when reactivating the user from the settings as well.

Adding a help center link to the deactivation modal as well makes sense to me.

Should I open issues first or post direct PRs?

If you think you it will not take much time and you have time currently to make these changes, you can directly open PR.
I have added a commit for reactivate user in PR #21436.
I also posted PR for the help center link in deactivate user confirmation modal.
I think the confirmation modal for reactivating user, is mostly dependent on the final stage of reactivate user from user popover, so I am currently waiting for that final stage to start work on it.
